answer: The volume of the cylinder is $bh=\pi r^2h$. The radius of the base is $3$ cm, so we have $9\pi h=45\pi\qquad\Rightarrow h=5$. The height of the cylinder is $\boxed{5}$ cm.
agents_response:
The volume $V$ of a cylinder is given by the formula $V=\pi r^2h$, where $r$ is the radius and $h$ is the height. Substituting the given values into this formula, we have

\begin{align*}
45\pi &= \pi(3)^2h\\
\Rightarrow\qquad 45& = 9h\\
\Rightarrow\qquad 5& = h 
\end{align*}

So the height of the cylinder is $\boxed{5}$ centimeters.
